meanings.definition: A group or set of four poles or points.
meanings.sent1: The children arranged the quadrupoles in a square formation during the game.
meanings.sent2: The construction workers used quadrupoles to mark the corners of the building foundation.
meanings.sent3: The quadrupoles at the park formed a perfect square, making it easy for visitors to navigate.
meanings.sent4: Her house was like a compass, with each room acting as a quadrupole pointing in a different direction.
meanings.sent5: The quadrupoles in the garden stood tall and proud, creating a unique focal point.

meanings.definition: A type of magnet with four poles.
meanings.sent1: The scientist used quadrupoles to manipulate the magnetic field in the experiment.
meanings.sent2: The quadrupoles in the lab were carefully calibrated for maximum efficiency.
meanings.sent3: When the magnets malfunctioned, the quadrupoles started attracting random objects in the room.
meanings.sent4: The quadrupoles hummed softly, creating a symphony of magnetic forces in the air.
meanings.sent5: The quadrupoles on the fridge held up multiple papers with ease, showcasing their strength.

meanings.definition: A type of lens with four poles.
meanings.sent1: The camera lens had quadrupoles that allowed for precise focusing of the image.
meanings.sent2: Photographers often prefer using quadrupoles for capturing detailed shots.
meanings.sent3: The special lens with quadrupoles made everything appear four times clearer than usual.
meanings.sent4: Her glasses acted like quadrupoles, helping her see the world with enhanced clarity.
meanings.sent5: The binoculars with quadrupoles provided a unique perspective of the distant mountains.
